# Shroud of Flame (Spell)
## Overview
[[Evocation Spells|Evocation]] \[[[Fire Spells|fire]]]

**Level:** [[5th Level Sorcerer Spells|Sorcerer 5]], [[5th Level Wizard Spells|Wizard 5]]

**BoXM:** [[BoXM 9th-Level Wizard Spells List|Wizard 9]]

**Casting Time:** 1 standard action

**Components:** V, S, M

**Range:** Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)

**Target:** One creature

**Duration:** 1 round/level

**Saving Throw:** None

**Spell Resistance:** Yes

**Source:** Spell Compendium (WotC), pg. 189

*You snap your fingers, and a small explosion of black smoke results. Nearby, one of your foes bursts into flames.*

This spell causes a creature to take 2d6 points of fire damage in each round of the spellâ€™s duration. The *shroud of flame* around the creature sheds bright illumination out to 40 feet and negates any concealment the creature might have.

Immersing the subject creature in a nonflammable liquid ends the spell.

*Material Component:* A pinch of saltpeter, a small piece of phosphorus, and a scrap of lace cloth or a spiderweb.
